questions.question: All flying operations are governed to some extend by CAR Part _____ (General Operating and Flight Rules.

As well as Part 91, you also need to comply with parts specific to your type of operation (eg. Microlights, or Air Operations), as well as more general Parts like Part _____ (Pilot Licenses and Ratings) and Part _____ (General Maintenance Rules).

references.text: CAR Part 61 - Pilot Licenses and Ratings

questions.question: Which CAR Part deals with Air Operator certification, and what does it mean for an Air Operator to be certificated?
questions.answer: Part 119. The operator has met, and continues to meet, all the operating and administration requirements stipulated in the appropriate CAR Part.

questions.question: Which CAR Part are most aircraft and aircraft parts certificated under?

references.text: CAR Part 21 - Certification of Products and Parts
